author: Alice Johnson
instructions: Boil fettuccine until al dente.
Sauté garlic in butter, then add heavy cream.
Stir in grated parmesan cheese until sauce thickens.
Add cooked chicken and combine with pasta.
Season with salt and pepper before serving.

author: Bob Smith
instructions: Heat olive oil in a pan and sauté onions until translucent.
Add ground beef and cook until browned.
Stir in tomato sauce and simmer for 15 minutes.
Boil spaghetti in salted water until al dente.
Serve sauce over spaghetti and top with grated cheese.

author: Charlie Davis
instructions: Preheat oven to 475°F (245°C).
Roll out pizza dough on a floured surface.
Spread tomato sauce evenly over dough.
Top with fresh mozzarella and basil leaves.
Bake for 10-12 minutes until crust is golden.

author: Diana Brown
instructions: Cook ground beef in a skillet until browned.
Add taco seasoning and a splash of water.
Simmer for 5 minutes to let flavors meld.
Warm tortillas in a separate pan.
Fill tortillas with beef, lettuce, cheese, and salsa.

author: Emily Harris
instructions: Heat oil in a wok or large pan.
Sauté garlic and ginger until fragrant.
Add mixed vegetables and stir-fry for 3-5 minutes.
Stir in soy sauce and a pinch of sugar.
Serve hot over steamed rice.

author: Frank White
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Place salmon fillets on a foil-lined baking sheet.
Mix melted butter with minced garlic and lemon juice.
Brush mixture onto salmon and season with salt and pepper.
Bake for 12-15 minutes until salmon flakes easily.

author: George Roberts
instructions: Slice chicken, bell peppers, and onions.
Season chicken with fajita seasoning.
Sauté chicken in a hot skillet until nearly cooked through.
Add vegetables and cook until tender.
Serve with warm tortillas, sour cream, and salsa.

author: Helen Clark
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
Cream butter and sugar in a mixing bowl.
Beat in eggs and vanilla extract.
Stir in flour, baking soda, and chocolate chips.
Drop spoonfuls of dough onto a baking sheet and bake for 10-12 minutes.

author: Ian Martinez
instructions: Chop tomatoes, cucumbers, and red onion.
Combine in a bowl with olives and feta cheese.
Drizzle with olive oil and red wine vinegar.
Season with salt, pepper, and oregano.
Toss gently and serve chilled.

author: James Wilson
instructions: Toast bread slices until golden.
Mash ripe avocados in a bowl with salt and pepper.
Spread avocado mixture onto toast.
Add optional toppings like cherry tomatoes or a fried egg.
Serve immediately.
